result.execSummary:
The defendant James L Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May petition for early discharged at 1 1/2 years.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to Probation while on Probation.  Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to Probation while on Probation.  Failure to pay may result in civil judgment.
Subject to Work Release.  NOT subject to Good Time.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Not to possess or use illegal substances. 
Not to have contact with Scott Schmid.
May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.
If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must provide DNA sample.
May write apology letter at discretion of Probation.

timeConds.notes: Banked/stayed for use by Probation if necessary.

CASES: 15CF393, 15CF493 & 15CF267. Defendant James L Anderson in court with attorney Shelly Tomtschik.  Defendant James L Anderson in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 11:42 am.  
Exh 1-victim impact statement.  Exh 2-restitution request.  CT finds elig for SA prm & CIP.  

Count 3-15CF393-w/h, probation.  4 mo CT, banked/stayed for use by probation.  No GT, subj to WR.  $250 DNA surcharge.  67 days credit.

Count 1-267-I&S 1 yr PCJ, subj to GT & WR.  83 days credit.

Count 1-493-I&S 1 yr PCJ, subj to GT & WR.  Concurrent w/ 267 if applicable.  68 days credit.

On all 3 counts, probation up to 3 yrs.  May petition for early discharge at 1 1/2 yrs.  $290.60 on ea count.  Order DNA sample on all 3.
Restitution to Scott Schmid-$200, Wal-mart $29.78 & 10% surcharge.  All payable thru probation, ftp-judgment.  NC with Mr Schmid.  May write apology letter at discretion of probation.  No illegal substances.  No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
